A powerful database helper package for Node.js applications
A powerful Node.js module that allows you to easily interact with databases

import { Card, CardGrid } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';
## About Helper.db is a powerful **Node.js** module that allows you to easily interact with databases. - Object-oriented - Predictable abstractions - Performant - 100% coverage of the database operations ## Installation **Node.js 16.9.0 or newer is required.** ```bash npm install helper.db yarn add helper.db pnpm add helper.db bun add helper.db ``` ### Optional packages - **zlib-sync** for WebSocket data compression and inflation (`npm install zlib-sync`) - **bufferutil** for a much faster WebSocket connection (`npm install bufferutil`) - **@helper/voice** for interacting with databases (`npm install @helper/voice`) ## Example usage Install helper.db: ```bash npm install helper.db ``` Register a slash command against the Discord API: ```javascript const { Database } = require('helper.db'); // Create a new database instance const db = new Database('./my-database.db'); // Store user data await db.set('users.123456789', { name: 'John Doe', level: 1, coins: 100 }); // Retrieve user data const user = await db.get('users.123456789'); console.log(user); // { name: 'John Doe', level: 1, coins: 100 } // Update specific properties await db.add('users.123456789.coins', 50); await db.set('users.123456789.level', 2); // Work with arrays await db.push('users.123456789.inventory', 'sword'); await db.push('users.123456789.inventory', 'shield'); // Check if data exists const hasUser = await db.has('users.123456789'); console.log(hasUser); // true ``` ## Links - [Website](https://helper-db.com) ([source](https://github.com/your-username/helper.db-docs)) - [Documentation](https://helper-db.com/docs) - [Guide](https://helper-db.com/guide) ([source](https://github.com/your-username/helper.db-guide)) - [Helper.db Discord server](https://discord.gg/helper-db) - [Discord API Discord server](https://discord.gg/discord-api) - [GitHub](https://github.com/your-username/helper.db) - [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/helper.db) ## Contributing Before creating an issue, please ensure that it hasn't already been reported/suggested, and double-check the documentation. ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Helper.db Server](https://discord.gg/helper-db).
Learn how to install and set up Helper.db in your project

## Requirements

- Node.js 14 or higher
- npm, yarn, or pnpm

## Installation

### Using npm

```bash
npm install helper.db
```

### Using yarn

```bash
yarn add helper.db
```

### Using pnpm

```bash
pnpm add helper.db
```

## Verify Installation

After installation, you can verify that Helper.db is working correctly:

```javascript
const { Database } = require('helper.db');

// Create a new database instance
const db = new Database('./test.db');

console.log('Helper.db installed successfully!');
```

## Next Steps

Now that you have Helper.db installed, you can:

1. Follow the [Quick Start guide](/guides/quick-start/) to learn the basics
2. Explore the [API Reference](/reference/database/) for detailed documentation
3. Check out [Examples](/examples/discord-bot/) to see Helper.db in action

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues during installation:

1. Make sure you have Node.js 14 or higher installed
2. Clear your npm cache: `npm cache clean --force`
3. Delete `node_modules` and `package-lock.json`, then reinstall
4. Check the [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/your-username/helper.db/issues) for known problems
Get started with Helper.db - A powerful database helper package

# Welcome to Helper.db

Helper.db is a powerful, easy-to-use database helper package designed to simplify database operations in Node.js applications. Whether you're building a simple bot or a complex web application, Helper.db provides an intuitive API that makes data management effortless.

## What is Helper.db?

Helper.db is a lightweight wrapper around various database engines that provides:

- **Simple API**: Easy-to-understand methods for common operations
- **Multiple Database Support**: Works with SQLite, JSON, and more
- **TypeScript Support**: Full type definitions included
- **Automatic Backups**: Built-in backup and restore functionality
- **Query Support**: Advanced querying capabilities
- **Performance Optimized**: Efficient operations for large datasets

## Key Features

### ðŸš€ Easy to Use
```javascript
const { Database } = require('helper.db');
const db = new Database('./mydata.db');

// Set data
await db.set('user.123', { name: 'John', age: 25 });

// Get data
const user = await db.get('user.123');
console.log(user); // { name: 'John', age: 25 }
```

### ðŸ“Š Multiple Data Types
Helper.db seamlessly handles various data types:
- Strings, Numbers, Booleans
- Objects and Arrays
- Nested data structures
- Binary data

### ðŸ”§ Advanced Operations
Beyond basic CRUD operations, Helper.db offers:
- Mathematical operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide)
- Array manipulation (push, pull, includes)
- Bulk operations
- Conditional updates

## Who Should Use Helper.db?

Helper.db is perfect for:

- **Discord Bot Developers**: Store user data, guild settings, and more
- **Web Developers**: Session management, user preferences, caching
- **Game Developers**: Player stats, leaderboards, game state
- **API Developers**: Configuration storage, rate limiting data
- **Students**: Learning database concepts with a simple interface

## Architecture

Helper.db is built with modularity in mind:

```
Helper.db
â”œâ”€â”€ Core Engine      # Main database operations
â”œâ”€â”€ Query System     # Advanced querying
â”œâ”€â”€ Backup Manager   # Automatic backups
â”œâ”€â”€ Type System      # TypeScript definitions
â””â”€â”€ Adapters         # Database-specific implementations
```

## Performance

Helper.db is optimized for performance:

- **Memory Efficient**: Minimal memory footprint
- **Fast Operations**: Optimized read/write operations
- **Connection Pooling**: Efficient database connections
- **Caching**: Intelligent caching for frequently accessed data
